abstract.t: DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) defines a domain-levelauthentication framework for email using public-key cryptography andkey server technology to permit verification of the source andcontents of messages by either Mail Transport Agents (MTAs) or MailUser Agents (MUAs). The primary DKIM protocol is described inThis document describes the records that senders may use to advertisehow they sign their outgoing mail, and how verifiers should accessand interpret those results.
